results.summary: A 31-year-old man is charged with the attempted murder of a pregnant woman.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/b6c99b7c-4a1c-3242-a52e-46060a5c09fa"><paragraph role="introduction">A 31-year-old man from Birmingham has been charged with attempted murder after a pregnant woman was stabbed in a car park.</paragraph><paragraph>The woman was attacked near Fitness First, Stirchley, on Pershore Road in Birmingham on 1 July. </paragraph><paragraph>Leon Harrison, from Swinford Road, Selly Oak, was arrested on 3 July after he handed himself in at a police station, West Midlands Police said.</paragraph><paragraph>He was due to appear before Birmingham Magistrates' Court on Tuesday.</paragraph><paragraph>The victim of the stabbing, who was in the early stages of pregnancy is now "on the road to recovery", police said.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/b6c99b7c-4a1c-3242-a52e-46060a5c09fa"><paragraph>A 31-year-old man from Birmingham has been charged with attempted murder after a pregnant woman was stabbed in a car park.</paragraph><paragraph>The woman was attacked near Fitness First, Stirchley, on Pershore Road in Birmingham on 1 July.</paragraph><paragraph>Leon Harrison, from Swinford Road, Selly Oak, was arrested on 3 July after he handed himself in at a police station, West Midlands Police said.</paragraph><paragraph>He was due to appear before Birmingham Magistrates' Court on Tuesday.</paragraph></shortFormBody>
results.headline: Man charged after pregnant woman stabbed in Stirchley
